column.name: Column Name
column.formulaHelp: Use other column names to write formulas. e.g., =ATK * 1.5
column.validationHelpDesc: Restricts the type and range of values entered in cells. Warnings are displayed for invalid values.

formula.hint: Enter a function name or column name after =

table.applyBulkEdit: Apply bulk value/formula to selected cells

templateSelector.title: Create New Sheet
templateSelector.subtitle: Filter by genre and category to find the right template

formulaHelper.title: Formula Helper
formulaHelper.formulaStart: starts with = to be recognized as formula
formulaHelper.settingsDesc: Get value from name/value structured sheet

export.codeGenerationDesc: Convert to game engine code (C#, GDScript, etc.)

import.codeImportDesc: Extract data from game engine code

formulaPreset.title: Formula Presets
formulaPreset.subtitle: Frequently used game balancing formulas
formulaPreset.selectPreset: Select a preset from the left

balanceValidator.title: Balance Validator
balanceValidator.helpOverviewDesc: The Balance Validator analyzes DPS (Damage Per Second) and EHP (Effective HP) to verify if units are balanced for their roles.
balanceValidator.helpStep1: Add units: Click 'Add Unit' to add characters to compare.
balanceValidator.helpStep3: Enter stats: Input HP, ATK, DEF, Attack Speed, Crit Rate, Crit Damage.
balanceValidator.helpStep4: Check results: Verify if DPS/EHP are within expected ranges.
balanceValidator.helpTankDesc: High survivability to absorb enemy attacks
balanceValidator.helpDpsDesc: High damage to eliminate enemies quickly
balanceValidator.helpSimulationDesc: Select two units and press ▶ to simulate combat. Check winner, battle time, and remaining HP to understand matchups.
balanceValidator.helpTip1: Units of the same role should have similar DPS/EHP
balanceValidator.helpTip2: Tank vs DPS should have ~50% win rate
balanceValidator.helpTip3: Total Value = (DPS% + EHP%) / 2 should be similar
balanceValidator.helpTip4: Std Dev under 15% indicates good overall balance
balanceValidator.tooltipDesc: Validates if input unit stats match the role (Tank/DPS/Support).
balanceValidator.tooltipVsAnalysis: vs Balance Analysis: Analysis is sheet-based pattern analysis, Validator is individual unit check
balanceValidator.tooltipVsSim: vs Combat Sim: Sim is actual combat, Validator is stat suitability

difficultyCurve.title: Difficulty Curve Design
difficultyCurve.powerBonusNote: Power Bonus: Player power increase on unlock
difficultyCurve.helpOverviewDesc: Difficulty Curve Design visualizes player vs enemy power balance across stages and helps design 'wall' sections and content unlock timing.
difficultyCurve.helpStep1: Select preset: Choose Casual/Balanced/Hardcore based on game style.
difficultyCurve.helpStep2: Set playtime: Configure target daily play time.
difficultyCurve.helpStep3: Set wall stages: Add points where players will be blocked.
difficultyCurve.helpStep4: Set milestones: Record content that unlocks at each stage.
difficultyCurve.helpCasualDesc: Player growth ↑, Enemy growth ↓, Wide wall intervals
difficultyCurve.helpBalancedDesc: Equal growth, Appropriate challenge, Walls every 10 stages
difficultyCurve.helpHardcoreDesc: Player growth ↓, Enemy growth ↑, Frequent walls
difficultyCurve.helpGraphDesc: Blue bar higher than red = easy section, Red higher = difficult section (wall).
difficultyCurve.helpPowerGrowthDesc: n: stage, growth: growth rate (Casual 1.12, Balanced 1.10, Hardcore 1.08/1.12)
difficultyCurve.helpWallPowerDesc: Enemy power +50% spike at wall stages
difficultyCurve.helpMilestonePowerDesc: Player power increase on content unlock (helps break walls)
difficultyCurve.helpTip1: Place walls before new content unlocks → builds anticipation
difficultyCurve.helpTip2: No walls in first 10 stages for smooth start
difficultyCurve.helpTip3: Stuck time at walls should be 30min~2hr
difficultyCurve.helpTip5: Set daily playtime target first, then design backwards
difficultyCurve.helpTip6: Milestones provide goal awareness (content unlock preview)

simulation.title: Combat Simulation
simulation.noUnitDataDesc: Run simulation on a sheet with Name, HP, ATK, DEF, Speed columns.

references.title: Reference Guide & Recommended Values
references.subtitle: Game design theory and practical guidelines
references.legendDescription: Values below are guidelines based on industry standards and successful case studies. Adjust according to your game's characteristics.
references.footerNote: Values are for reference only. Adjust based on your game's genre and target audience.

theory.flowDesc: Difficulty-skill balance curve for optimal game experience. Design to keep players in a flow state between boredom and anxiety.
theory.schreiberDesc: Online course systematically covering mathematical approaches to game balance. Covers probability, growth curves, economy systems.
theory.mdaDesc: Mechanics, Dynamics, Aesthetics - Core game design framework that forms the basis of balance design.
theory.perfectImbalanceDesc: Why imbalanced design creates balanced play - Rock-paper-scissors relationships and metagame design.
theory.perfectImbalanceMetaValue: Replay value through continuous strategy discovery

damage.formulaDesc: Analysis of damage formula patterns like ATK - DEF, ATK × (100 / (100 + DEF)), ATK × (1 - DEF%) and their characteristics.
damage.ttkDesc: Weapon/skill balancing through Time To Kill and Damage Per Second calculations. Provides appropriate TTK standards by genre.
damage.ehpDesc: Effective health calculation combining defense, evasion, and damage reduction. Used for tank vs dealer balance.
damage.armorPenDesc: LoL/Dota style armor penetration system. Applied in order: % reduction → flat reduction → % penetration → flat penetration.
damage.armorPenOrderValue: % red → flat red → % pen → flat pen
damage.defTypeDesc: Defense formula selection by game genre. Each formula has different scaling characteristics.
damage.defTypeSubtractValue: ATK - DEF - simple, hard to scale

growth.linearDesc: y = base + (level × increment). Predictable and intuitive growth. Strong early, weak late characteristics.
growth.expDesc: y = base × ratio^level. Rapid late game growth. Watch for power inflation.
growth.logDesc: y = base + (multiplier × log(level)). Diminishing returns effect. Fast early, slow late.
growth.sCurveDesc: Slow early → rapid mid → converging late. Natural growth pattern adopted by many games.

economy.faucetSinkDesc: Design resource inflow (Faucet) and outflow (Sink) to prevent inflation and maintain healthy economy.
economy.currencyDesc: Multi-layer currency structure design (gold-diamond-premium). Separate acquisition difficulty and usage for each currency.
economy.timeMoneyDesc: Balance point design between F2P time investment and paying users' monetary investment.

gacha.pityDesc: Pity system - guaranteed acquisition after certain failures. Design considering expected value and user psychology.
gacha.softHardDesc: Combination of soft pity (gradual rate increase) and hard pity (100% guarantee) for finer probability control.
gacha.rateDesc: Base probability design by rarity. Probability distribution based on rarity and value.
gacha.expectedDesc: Calculate expected attempts to goal. Uses formula: 1-(1-p)^n = target probability.

stage.scalingDesc: Enemy strengthening design per stage/wave. Difficulty curve and reward balance.
stage.rewardDesc: Reward increase rate design per stage. Progression motivation and inflation prevention.
stage.restDesc: Relaxation zones after difficulty spikes. Player fatigue management.

features.title: Key Features in This Tool
features.templatesDesc: 32 predefined sheet templates (stats, equipment, skills, enemies, economy, gacha, stages)
features.formulasDesc: 23 game-specific functions (DAMAGE, TTK, DPS, EHP, GACHA_PITY, etc.)
features.calculatorDesc: Real-time DPS, TTK, EHP, damage, scaling calculations
features.visualizationDesc: Growth curves, radar charts, bar charts, histograms

simulation.title: Combat Simulation
simulation.monteCarloDesc: Win rate, TTK, DPS statistics through 1,000~100,000 iterations
simulation.teamBattleDesc: 1:N, N:N multi-unit combat, targeting mode support

analysis.title: Balance Analysis
analysis.perfectImbalanceDesc: Rock-paper-scissors analysis, dominant/weak unit detection, cycle detection
analysis.powerCurveDesc: Level stat growth pattern analysis (linear/exp/log), R² fitting accuracy
analysis.correlationDesc: Pearson correlation for stat relationships, duplicate stat detection
analysis.deadzoneDesc: Identify unused stat ranges in game
analysis.diminishingDesc: Defense, crit rate efficiency analysis, recommended ranges

goalSolver.title: Goal Solver
goalSolver.ttkDamageDesc: Reverse calculate damage per hit from target kill time
goalSolver.survivalHPDesc: Calculate required HP from target survival time
goalSolver.reductionDefDesc: Reverse calculate defense from target reduction rate
goalSolver.dpsCritDesc: Calculate stats needed to achieve target DPS
goalSolver.growthRateDesc: Reverse calculate growth rate per level from target final value

goalSolver.title: Goal Solver
goalSolver.helpDesc: Calculate the required input value from your desired result.
goalSolver.helpVsFormula: vs Formula Helper: Formula is forward (input→result), Solver is reverse (result→input)

imbalanceDetector.title: Imbalance Detector
imbalanceDetector.helpDesc: Scans sheet data to automatically find and warn about potential issues.
imbalanceDetector.helpCliff: - Cliff: Sharp changes in consecutive values
imbalanceDetector.helpVariance: - Variance: Large deviation within same group
imbalanceDetector.helpVsAnalysis: vs Balance Analysis: Analysis is deep pattern analysis, Detector is immediate issue finding
imbalanceDetector.settingsTooltip: Lower values = more sensitive detection. Too low = false positives, too high = miss issues.
imbalanceDetector.powerCreepTooltipDesc: Checks how much stronger late units are vs early.
imbalanceDetector.varianceTooltipDesc: Measures stat deviation in same level/grade units. (CV = std/mean)
imbalanceDetector.cliffTooltipDesc: Detects sharp stat changes between consecutive levels.
imbalanceDetector.recommendedSettingsDesc: Use defaults when starting. If too many false positives, increase values. If missing issues, decrease values.

calculator.title: Calculator
calculator.subtitle: Quick TTK, DPS, EHP calculation
calculator.helpDesc: Calculate core metrics for game balancing: TTK, DPS, EHP, etc.
calculator.helpDps: DPS: Damage per second, TTK: Time to kill
calculator.helpEhp: EHP: Effective HP, SCALE: Growth curves
calculator.helpTip: Use ? button in each tab for detailed help

dps.title: DPS (Damage Per Second)
dps.desc: Total damage you can deal to enemy per second.
dps.example: Sword A: 100×1.0=100 DPS, Sword B: 50×2.5=125 DPS

ttk.title: TTK (Time To Kill)
ttk.desc: Time required to defeat an enemy.

linear.name: Linear
linear.desc: Same increase per level. Predictable and intuitive.
linear.useCase: Casual games, beginner-friendly balance. Same stat increase from level 1→50.

exponential.name: Exponential
exponential.desc: Rapid increase at higher levels. Hardcore late-game feel.
exponential.useCase: XP tables, enhancement costs, MMO endgame. Big gap between high and low level players.

logarithmic.name: Logarithmic
logarithmic.desc: Fast early growth, slows down later.
logarithmic.useCase: Reduce level gap, catch-up systems. Keep stat difference small between high levels.

quadratic.name: Quadratic
quadratic.useCase: Skill damage scaling, mid-late power spikes. RPG skill coefficients.

presetComparison.title: Preset Comparison
presetComparison.subtitle: Analyze differences between two sheets or snapshots
presetComparison.helpDesc: Compare differences between two sheets or snapshots.
presetComparison.helpUseCase: Use case: Balance patch before/after comparison, A/B testing

growthCurve.title: Growth Curve Chart
growthCurve.helpDesc: Curves that determine how much stats increase when leveling up. Completely changes the growth feel.

linearHelp.name: Linear
linearHelp.desc: Same increase every level. Predictable and intuitive. Casual games, beginner-friendly.

exponentialHelp.name: Exponential
exponentialHelp.desc: Explosive late-game increase. Idle/clicker games, XP tables, enhancement costs.

logarithmicHelp.name: Logarithmic
logarithmicHelp.desc: Fast early growth, slows later. Reduce level gap, catch-up systems, mastery.

quadraticHelp.name: Quadratic
quadraticHelp.desc: Slow start, accelerates. Gentler than exponential. RPG skill coefficients, mid-late power spikes.

sCurveHelp.name: S-Curve (Sigmoid)
sCurveHelp.desc: Slow early/late, fast mid-growth. Natural growth feel. RPGs with level caps, stat ceilings.

growthCurve.helpTip: Tip: HP/DEF → Linear/Log, ATK/Gold → Exp/Quadratic, Capped stats → S-curve recommended

comparisonChart.title: Comparison Analysis
comparisonChart.helpDesc: Visually compare stats of characters, weapons, and items.
comparisonChart.helpSelectTarget: Select at least 1 target and 3+ stats to compare.
comparisonChart.helpUsage: Select rows from sheet → Add All → Check columns to compare
comparisonChart.modalHelpDesc: Compare stats of characters, weapons, and items at a glance to find balance issues.
comparisonChart.usageGuide: Usage: Select rows from sheet → Click "Add All" → Check columns to compare → View chart
comparisonChart.selectPrompt: Select targets and items to compare on the left
comparisonChart.selectTargetAndItems: Select targets and items to compare on the left
comparisonChart.selectColumnToAnalyze: Select a column to analyze on the left

gameEngineExport.title: Game Engine Export
gameEngineExport.subtitle: Export to Unity, Unreal, Godot formats
gameEngineExport.selectFormat: Select export format from the left
gameEngineExport.footerHelp: Copy generated files to the appropriate location in your game project

gameEngineImport.title: Game Engine Import
gameEngineImport.subtitle: Import from Unity, Unreal, Godot formats
gameEngineImport.dragOrClick: Drag file or click to upload
gameEngineImport.selectFileForPreview: Preview will show when file is selected

welcome.title: Welcome to Game Balance Tool
welcome.description: This tool helps game designers manage and calculate character stats, weapon damage, level tables, and more.
welcome.tip: Use it like Excel, but with game-specific formulas built in.

guidelines.title: Recommended Values Guide
guidelines.description: Industry-standard values commonly used in game balancing. Reference these during your work.
guidelines.tip: You can always access this guide from the "References" menu at the top.

createProject.title: Step 1: Create Project
createProject.description: Click the "New Project" button in the left sidebar.
createProject.action: New Project → Enter name → Press Enter
createProject.tip: Project = One game. You can manage multiple games separately.

createSheet.title: Step 2: Create Sheet
createSheet.description: Create data sheets within your project. Click the "+" button in the top tabs.
createSheet.action: + Button → Select template or empty sheet
createSheet.tip: Templates auto-generate basic structures for RPG characters, FPS weapons, etc.

inputData.title: Step 3: Input Data
inputData.description: Click any cell to start typing. Enter numbers or text.
inputData.action: Click cell → Enter value → Press Enter
inputData.tip: Enter to confirm, Esc to cancel

formulaBasic.title: Step 4: Using Formulas (Core!)
formulaBasic.description: Start with = to create a formula. Reference other cells or perform calculations.
formulaBasic.action: Click cell → Type = → Write formula → Press Enter
formulaBasic.tip: Use column names to reference values in the same row.

formulaDamage.title: Step 5: Game Formula - DAMAGE
formulaDamage.description: Built-in damage calculation formulas commonly used in games.
formulaDamage.tip: Formula: ATK × (100 ÷ (100 + DEF)). Higher DEF = lower damage.

formulaDps.title: Step 6: Game Formula - DPS
formulaDps.description: Calculate DPS (Damage Per Second) including critical hits.

formulaScale.title: Step 7: Game Formula - SCALE
formulaScale.description: Calculate stat growth by level. Supports linear, exponential, logarithmic, and more.

done.title: Ready to Go!
done.description: Now try it yourself. Check the Formula Helper (bottom of screen) for all available functions.
done.tip: Use the "Test" feature in Formula Helper to verify formulas first.
